body.class: home page-template-default page page-id-16 custom-background locale-en-us no-sidebar-full-width wide

div.p: In the pursuit of excellence and equity, the Lewisburg Area School District is an inclusive learning community that supports students as they realize lives of purpose and fulfillment in our diverse global society.

li.a: Apply for Free / Reduced Price Lunches
Fall Play Rehearsal Schedules and Performance Information

div.p: Please click here for a copy of the LASD Continuity of Education Plan
Please click here for information regarding free internet service from Service Electric Cablevision for new internet customers.

span.strong: Enrichment, Extension, and Practice Learning Activities

div.p: During this time of school closure, the staff of the Lewisburg Area School District has put together grade level and subject matter suggestions for students to stay connected to learning. These activities are for enrichment, extension and practice. The links below for each school, and subsequently grade and content area, are open to all students so that students may challenge themselves and explore learning activities in areas of interest that they may not have previously had the opportunity to study. Please note: the links below list both online and non-technology based activities. Please check back frequently for updates!
Additional enrichment resources for parents and students here from the CSIU (Central Susquehanna Intermediate Unit).

Additional resources here for Grades K-3 and here for Grades 4 – 12 from WVIA (PBS Station). You can tune in to WVIA (PBS Station) from 1 pm to 4 pm daily for programming appropriate to students grades 4 to 12.
Additional resources here to support reading.

p.span: The Lewisburg Area School District will be providing student meals on the days listed on this calendar link (PDF). New! Click on the May 2020 Meal Calendar (PDF). The same number of meals will be distributed each week, just on what is essentially an every other day basis.

span.style: font-family: georgia, palatino, serif; color: black;

p.span: Distribution sites remain as they were previously: Kelly Elementary, Eichhorn Middle School, Old Lewisburg Area High School, and Click here for additional food delivery site information

span.style: font-family: georgia, palatino, serif; color: black;

p.span: Meals/food will be distributed to any school age child, regardless of paid, free, or reduced-price lunch status, provided they are present with their parent, guardian, or are able to show school identification if they come alone.​

div.p: New! Sheetz is offering free meals for kids each day (turkey sandwich, chips, and a drink). Click here to go to the Sheetz website for more information.
Please click here for information on learn more about the virus, the national and PA response, suggestions for talking to your students, and for community resources in the event you need support.
April 9 – School Closure Update
Please click here for information regarding the announcement that schools are to be closed for the remainder of the 2019/20 school year.
April 1 – Communication for Parents of Special Education Students
For important information regarding special education services during the school closure please click here for information in English.
Para obtener información importante sobre los servicios de educación especial durante el cierre de la escuela, haga clic aquí para obtener información en español.
Archive – Click here for archive news information.
Click here to apply for free / reduced lunches.
Click here for additional information on the 2020 bond issuance. Click here (PDF) to read the approved 2020 bond resolution.
2 days ago

p.span:
The Lewisburg Children’s Museum (LCM) is pleased to announce they will be offering virtual experiences to keep children socializing and engaged during this time of stay-at-home. In addition to free activity ideas and resources, starting Thursday, April 30, the LCM is introducing weekly virtual experiences through Zoom as part of a Museum-at-Home series.
Offerings include: Virtual Preschool Art, which features instructor facilitated art activities with common materials that you find around the house; Virtual Yoga, which will encourage children to focus on using their breath to connect with their bodies through basic yoga poses; Virtual Sign Language for Kids, which will introduce children to the basics of American Sign Language and Deaf culture through activities, games, and songs; Virtual Spanish for Kids, which introduces children to basic Spanish vocabulary and phrases; and Virtual Music’s the Balm with Music Together.
The Museum is also introducing Virtual Parties, which enable children and their friends to gather for an online hangout. The LCM shares the platform and facilitates a game and craft activity for participants. On Wednesdays at 10:00 am, LCM staff also host PopUp PlayDates through Facebook Live. PopUp PlayDates are designed to engage children and families with hands-on activities that they can easily do at home.
If you are able, please consider sharing these opportunities with your students and their families. More information can be found at: www.lewisburgchildrensmuseum.org/museum-at-home

div.p: www.lewisburgchildrensmuseum.org
div.span: The LCM is pleased to offer resources to support children and famlies during this time of stay-at-home and social distancing.

meta.content: 325 HOSPITAL DR LEWISBURG PA 17837 United States

div.p: Kindergarten Registration for 2020-2021 school year will take place, by appointment only, on 4/14, 4/15 and 4/16. Please call the office for instructions and an appointment time. 570-522-3292.

div.h3: 9:00 am: Mobile Dentist at Kelly, by advance appointment

span.span: 9:00 am: Mobile Dentist at Kelly, by advance appointment

meta.content: Mobile Dentist at Kelly, by advance appointment
325 HOSPITAL DR LEWISBURG PA 17837 United States

div.p: The Mobile Dentist will be at Kelly Elementary, seeing students who have been signed up in advance. Nurse Angie Kustanbauter is the person to contact to schedule a dental visit for your Kelly Elementary student. 570-522-3287
